        public static Wedge lightWedge(Wedge w,

      • lW

        public static Wedge[] lW(Wedge original,
                         Wedge w,
                         Wedge[] floodlights,
                         Point[] points,
                         processing.core.PApplet sketch,
                         int stepByStep,
                         java.lang.String path,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         int iteration)
        Lights a wedge w with a set of floodlights and a set of points given.
        The algorithm divides awedge in two new wedges, divides the set of points and the set of floodlights by the half; then recursively lights the two new wedges using the half of the original given elements .
        If stepByStep is greater than 0, then the program will draw, sleep and finally save a file with the image between of every steps.
        Parameters:
        original - The original wedge that we are about to light. This parameter is not necessary for the algorithm, but its used to be painted when the stepByStep option is activated.
        w - The wedge we are about to light.
        floodlights - Array with the set of floodlights that the algorithm will use to light w
        points - Array with the set of points that the algorithm will use to place the floodlights.
        sketch - the Processing object that will draw,
        stepByStep - the seconds the algorithm will stop after painting each step.
        path - The file path where the program saves the files.
        name - The name of the file.
        iteration - The number of iteration
        Returns:

      • setFloodlightsOnPoint

        public static Wedge[] setFloodlightsOnPoint(Wedge[] wedges,
                                            Point center)
        Aligns a set of given wedges at a given point. Takes the first wedge on the array and translates it to the point center, then takes the next floodlight and translates it too but aligning it with the last floodlight placed.
        Parameters:
        wedges - The wedges that will be aligned.
        center - The point where the floodlights will be placed.
        Returns:

      • massCenter

        public static Point massCenter(java.util.ArrayList<Point> points)
        Given a list of points of a convex polygon, calculates the mass center, which is the point (x,y), where x is equal to the sum of all the x-coordinates of every point divided by n and y is the sum of all the y-coordinates of every point in the list divided by n.
        Parameters:
        points - The list of the points of a convex polygon.
        Returns:

      • hamSandwich

        public static Line hamSandwich(java.lang.Double pendant,
                               Point[] points,
                               processing.core.PApplet applet)
        Given a set of points and a pendant, it finds a line which divides the set in two parts, leaving the half of points in one side of the line and the rest of points in the other, if the length of the set is odd it rounds half up the set
        Parameters:
        pendant - the pendant of the line that divides the set (slope)
        points - the set of points we want to divide
        applet - the applet that draws in the processing's canvas
        Returns:
        a line that divides the set of points by the half

      • hamSandwich

        public static Line hamSandwich(java.lang.Double pendant,
                               Point[] points,
                               int pointsOnSide,
                               processing.core.PApplet applet)
        Given a set of points, a pendant and a natural k number, it finds a line which divides the set in two parts, leaving k points in one side(left) of the line and the rest of points in the other(right).
        Parameters:
        pendant - the pendant of the line that divides the set (slope)
        points - the set of points we want to divide
        pointsOnSide - the number of points the algorithm is going to leave in one side of the line, this humber must be non negative.
        applet - the applet that draws in the processing's canvas
        Returns:
        a line that divides the set of points by the half
